articles.title: Non-Disclosure Of Prior Live-In Relationship Amounts To 'Fraud' U/S 12(1)(c) Of Hindu Marriage Act: Jharkhand High Court
articles.summary: The Jharkhand High Court has held that the non-disclosure of a prior live-in relationship before marriage constitutes fraud as to a material fact under Section 12(1)(c) of the Hindu Marriage Act, 1955 . The Court emphasised that while Hindu marriage is a sacrament and not a contract, the concealment of such a relationship to obtain consent renders the marriage voidable and liable to be annulled by a decree of nullity. In doing so, they have fueled an increasingly political issue, with President Donald Trump and lawmakers across the country criticizing the computing sites for driving up energy costs and straining local water supplies.

articles.title: Shadowfax Technologies shares list at 9% discount on IPO price
articles.summary: Shadowfax Technologies shares began trading on Dalal Street at a discount. The company's IPO saw subdued demand, with grey market premiums turning negative. Institutional investors showed more interest than retail and non-institutional investors. Proceeds will fund expansion and operational scaling. The company operates in e-commerce and hyperlocal delivery.

articles.title: OpenAI's Altman, Apple's Cook become latest CEOs to criticise ICE after Minneapolis killing
articles.summary: Federal agents shot and killed a protester in Minneapolis over the weekend, the second such shooting this month, sparking widespread disapproval of the Immigration and Customs Enforcement's actions. More than 60 CEOs have signed a statement calling ‌for de-escalation after ‌weeks of silence.

articles.title: TikTok faces app deletions, censorship claims, glitches in days after ownership change
articles.summary: Censorship claims, technical problems and a report of a surge in app deletions are just some of the challenges TikTok is facing as it adjusts to a new ownership structure in the United States that was finalized last week.

articles.title: Amazon to close Amazon Go, Amazon Fresh stores, focus on Whole Foods and online grocery delivery
articles.summary: The Seattle-based online retailer said Tuesday in a blog post that it plans to convert some of those soon-to-be shuttered locations into Whole Foods Market stores. The company operates 57 Amazon Fresh stores and 15 Amazon Go stores.

articles.title: Anthropic hikes 2026 revenue forecast 20%: Report
articles.summary: Anthropic ⁠has raised its revenue ‌forecasts ‌for ‌the next several years, projecting sales to ​quadruple ​this year ‌to ‍as ‍much as $18 billion and reach $55 ‌billion next year, The Information reported on ‍Tuesday.

articles.title: Amazon bungles Wednesday layoff plan with misfired internal email
articles.summary: Amazon ‍on Tuesday appeared ​to have mistakenly alerted many Amazon ⁠Web Services cloud computing employees about layoffs planned for Wednesday morning with a commiseration email and ‌team-wide meeting ‌invite sent hours early.

articles.title: DLI 2.0 is targeting six key chip types, 80% local build: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: The government is finalising the second phase of the Design-Linked Incentive (DLI) scheme to boost India’s semiconductor capabilities, focusing on six key chip categories and supporting 50 fabless companies. By 2032, India aims to produce advanced 2-3 nm chips and cover 80% of domestic electronic system needs. Annual deeptech awards will also be introduced.

articles.title: Crypto money-laundering hit $82 billion in 2025, researchers say
articles.summary: Money launderers received at least $82 billion in cryptocurrencies ‍last year, up sharply from $10 ​billion in 2020, driven in part by fast growth ⁠among Chinese-speaking groups, blockchain researchers said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Elon Musk vs Vinod Khosla: Why the tech giants are fighting again
articles.summary: Khosla’s response to a Musk post in September kicked off the latest spat. The founder of Khosla Ventures has accused the owner of Tesla and X of promoting a racist ideology.

articles.title: EU deal to open $750 billion electronics market for Indian manufacturers
articles.summary: India's electronics sector is set for significant growth. A new trade deal grants Indian manufacturers easier access to the European Union's large electronics market. This agreement is expected to boost India's electronics exports to $50 billion by 2031. Indian companies will also benefit from cheaper access to advanced European machinery for producing complex electronics and semiconductors.

articles.title: WhatsApp unveils high-security mode, latest tech firm to offer users stronger protection
articles.summary: Meta's WhatsApp messaging service is offering users an advanced ‍security mode, joining a growing ​number of US tech firms that are letting users ⁠opt into stronger protections against hackers in exchange for a more restrictive experience.

articles.title: Jury selection begins in landmark social media addiction trial
articles.summary: Jury selection begins Tuesday for a landmark trial that could establish a legal precedent on whether social media companies deliberately designed their platforms to addict children. Defendants in the suit are Alphabet, ByteDance and Meta, the tech titans behind YouTube, TikTok and Instagram. Meta cofounder and chief executive Mark Zuckerberg is slated to be called as a witness during the trial.

articles.title: India’s industrial output growth hits over two-year high of 7.8% in December
articles.summary: December 2025 witnessed an impressive upswing in India's industrial production, rising by 7.8 percent annually—the fastest growth rate seen in over two years. The manufacturing, mining, and electricity sectors played pivotal roles in this advancement, notably with infrastructure and construction goods at the forefront. This momentum heralds a significant economic flourishing as the year wraps up.

articles.title: India-EU FTA opens pathways for Indian manufacturers to compete globally: TVS Motor
articles.summary: India and the European Union have signed a significant free trade agreement. This landmark deal is expected to transform business environments for Indian industries. It will strengthen supply chains and create new avenues for innovation-led Indian manufacturers. TVS Motor Company sees this as a major milestone, focusing on opportunities in Europe and beyond.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices at record highs: Why India may increase duties on their imports
articles.summary: India's gold and silver imports hit record highs in 2025, despite soaring prices, raising concerns over the widening trade deficit and a weakening rupee. Policymakers face challenges curbing these inflows, as investment demand, particularly in ETFs, has surged, offsetting a slowdown in jewellery purchases.

articles.title: Iran unrest does not have a significant impact on India Inc’s global trade: Crisil
articles.summary: While India Inc's global trade and credit profiles remain largely unaffected by Iran's unrest, potential disruptions loom for sectors like oil refining, aviation, and crude-linked industries if tensions escalate. Direct trade with Iran is minimal, but rising crude prices could impact various sectors, with basmati rice and fruit/nut traders facing specific challenges.

articles.title: India-EU free trade agreement boosts seafood exports: Duties to drop to zero
articles.summary: Indian seafood exporters anticipate a significant boost in trade with the European Union once the free trade agreement becomes operational. The elimination of duties, ranging from 4.7% to 7.5%, is expected to create a level playing field with competitors. Addressing non-trade barriers, such as extensive product sampling, is crucial for India to achieve market leadership in the EU seafood sector.

articles.title: Yotta eyeing India listing to ride the AI tech wave here
articles.summary: “We are in the process of doing diligence for a listing in India. We are open for a pre-IPO (initial public offering) round right now. We're in touch with HNIs (high-net-worth individuals), family offices and funds,” Sunil Gupta said. He pointed out that while the timeline is not fixed, they are exploring FY27.

articles.title: Infosys’ recruitment drive offering record packages ends tomorrow
articles.summary: The company is offering trainee specialist programmers salaries of Rs 21 lakh and Rs 16 lakh per annum for L3 and L2 levels, respectively. Those hired at L1 level will get Rs 10 lakh per annum, plus a joining bonus of Rs 1 lakh.

articles.title: Shadowfax’s muted listing; Indian AI founders head to US in droves
articles.summary: Logistics company Shadowfax made a lukewarm debut at the bourses. This and more in today’s ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: UK proposes forcing Google to let publishers opt out of AI summaries
articles.summary: Britain's competition watchdog wants Google to let news sites choose if their content feeds AI. This aims to boost competition in the UK search market. Google's AI summaries have reduced traffic to news articles. The watchdog also wants Google to be transparent and cite sources. Fair search result ranking and easier search engine switching are also proposed.

articles.title: AI to replace repetitive jobs, create new opportunities: Science advisor
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a disruptive technology and will replace a lot of repetitive jobs, but will also create new opportunities and India has to be prepared for this realignment, the government's top science advisor said.

articles.title: Robotics startup AquaAirX raises Rs 12.5 crore from Zerodha's Rainmatter, Prime Venture Partners, others
articles.summary: Robotics startup AquaAirX, which builds drones, has raised Rs 12.5 crore in a round led by Rainmatter, the investment arm of Zerodha. The round also saw participation from Prime Venture Partners, Wyser and India Accelerator.

articles.title: TCS CEO K Krithivasan says AI will not trigger mass layoffs: FT report
articles.summary: Speaking to the Financial Times, Krithivasan said he does not expect AI to upend the global outsourcing industry, currently valued at $300 billion, noting that enterprises will continue to rely on large technology vendors to manage complex systems even as automation accelerates.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: Kolkata godown fire: 21 dead, 23 missing; Wow! Momos denies blaze started at Anandpur warehouse
articles.summary: A fire in Kolkata's Anandpur killed 21 workers and left 23 missing, ravaging two godowns including Wow! Momos' warehouse. Both lacked fire safety clearances, sparking safety concerns.

articles.title: Ex‑Amazon employee says work experience is now a liability, announces Congressional bid
articles.summary: Amazon lays off 16,000 globally; veteran AI leader says experience is now a liability, criticizes global labor practices, and announces Congressional run to fix “rules” around work.

articles.title: India considers expansion in definition of start-ups to promote innovation in deep-tech
articles.summary: Sources explained that the expanded definition of start-ups aims to incentivise more companies to innovate.

articles.title: EXCLUSIVE | Sporting equipment manufacturing may get big push in Budget 2026; new scheme in the works: Sources
articles.summary: The Centre may announce incentives for sports goods manufacturing in the Union Budget, aiming to boost exports, modernise hubs like Meerut and Jalandhar, and leverage new FTAs from April 2026.

articles.title: India–EU FTA likely to boost two-wheeler exports and premium segment: TVS Chairman
articles.summary: Sudarshan Venu, Chairman of TVS Motor, said the company delivered a strong performance in the December quarter, driven by healthy domestic demand and a pickup in exports. He added that recent government steps, including tax relief for the middle class, have improved consumer sentiment and supported industry growth. This has helped the two-wheeler sector record its fastest expansion in the past eight to nine years.

articles.title: Indian economy shows steady momentum in December, says new monthly economy index by Moneycontrol
articles.summary: Moneycontrol’s Eco Pulse is a composite high-frequency index which aims to measure India’s economic momentum on a monthly basis and provide early signals of changes in the direction of GDP growth

articles.title: Crude oil prices may average $59-60/barrel in 2026 amid geopolitical risks: S&P Global Energy
articles.summary: S P Global Energy President Dave Ernsberger said oil and gas markets are adjusting to geopolitical and trade uncertainties without major disruption. Ernsberger also said India has more options to diversify its energy suppliers, which supports the country’s energy security.

articles.title: Budget 2026 unlikely to move markets in a big way: Samir Arora
articles.summary: Helios Capital’s Samir Arora said that lower taxes could improve sentiment and returns, while currency weakness continues to hurt foreign investors.

articles.title: Duty-free access to EU could unlock $263 billion market for Indian textiles: Commerce Ministry
articles.summary: Industry bodies estimate a sharp acceleration in India’s apparel exports to Europe once the free trade agreement comes into force, with full tariff elimination expected to improve competitiveness against rivals such as Bangladesh and deepen India’s footprint across key EU markets.

articles.title: Cheers for import of expensive wines from EU, set to get cheaper in India under FTA
articles.summary: While there will be no duty concessions for wines priced below 2.5 Euros, India's duties on expensive wines from the 27-nation bloc are slated to drop from 150% to 20% in a calibrated manner over a period of 7 years.

articles.title: Defence Budget 2026: Expectations point to double-digit growth, modernisation, drones, missiles, and indigenous manufacturing
articles.summary: Expectations for Defence Budget 2026 indicate double-digit growth, focusing on modernisation, drones, missiles, R D, and indigenous manufacturing to strengthen India’s security amid rising geopolitical challenges.

articles.title: India’s FY27 earnings growth may remain under 10%: Ambit’s Dhiraj Agarwal
articles.summary: Continued earnings downgrades, fading demand, and persistent foreign investor outflows may keep Indian equities under pressure, says Ambit’s Dhiraj Agarwal.

articles.title: India is building TV for your phone, testing YouTube's ad monopoly
articles.summary: Direct-to-Mobile broadcasting is emerging as a potential new frontier in India’s media and advertising landscape, with industry experts suggesting it could unlock mass free-to-air content delivery on smartphones and create a strong alternative to existing digital video platforms.

articles.title: Wow! Momo mourns Kolkata warehouse fire deaths, announces lifetime support for families
articles.summary: Wow! Momo mourns three deaths in a Kolkata warehouse fire, pledges support and aid to families, and is cooperating with the investigation.

articles.title: Secret Alchemist raises $3 million to grow clean fragrances and offline presence across India
articles.summary: Clean fragrance startup Secret Alchemist plans to use its newly raised $3 million seed funding to accelerate product innovation, strengthen its team, and build offline discovery touchpoints, as it targets deeper penetration in tier-two India and prepares for an international foray into markets like the UAE and Europe.

articles.title: AssetPlus raises ₹175 crore to expand assisted wealth management and grow distributor base
articles.summary: AssetPlus plans to use its fresh ₹175-crore funding to expand its mutual fund distributor network, strengthen its technology platform, and add new offerings such as global investing, PMS and insurance, as it targets profitability over the next two years.

articles.title: Shadowfax targets ₹4,000-4,500 crore revenue in FY26, sees gradual margin improvement
articles.summary: Shadowfax CEO Abhishek Bansal said quick commerce could grow to up to 40% of business over the next few years, while value-added services will remain a key revenue driver. Shadowfax shares listed at a discount to the issue price on both the BSE and NSE.

articles.title: TikTok settles social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial against Meta, YouTube
articles.summary: TikTok is one of four companies, including Meta, Snap and YouTube, which is a unit of Alphabet-owned Google, facing allegations that their platforms are fuelling a youth mental health crisis.

articles.title: Amazon to shut Go and Fresh physical stores in US, expand online grocery delivery
articles.summary: Amazon also said it will significantly expand its Whole Foods Market footprint, opening over 100 new stores over the next few years.

articles.title: Maruti Suzuki Q3 Preview: Healthy volumes, SUVs to boost margins; revenue to grow double-digits
articles.summary: Maruti Suzuki is expected to report Q3FY26 earnings on January 28, with net profit likely up 26% to ₹4,424 crore and revenue up 32% to ₹50,996 crore. Strong volume growth, higher SUV contribution, and better pricing are expected to support revenue and margin, though higher raw material costs and discounts may limit gains.

articles.title: Travel startup Escape Plan raises $25 million to open 200+ stores across India
articles.summary: Backed by Jungle Ventures, Escape Plan is accelerating its omnichannel expansion, focusing on deeper penetration in Tier I and Tier II towns, a rapid rollout of physical stores, and consistent consumer experience across online and offline channels as it targets a larger share of India’s travel accessories market.

articles.title: Top Stories | India-EU landmark trade deal, stocks rebound, Adani-Airbus deal, and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: As Indian savers seek returns beyond FDs, Wint Wealth raises ₹250 crore to offer "FD-plus" without equity risk
articles.summary: As equity volatility pushes investors to rethink portfolio allocation, Wint Wealth is positioning bonds as a regular investment habit rather than a one-time trade. Backed by strong repeat usage and regulatory clarity, the platform says retail demand for predictable, higher-than-FD returns is accelerating.

articles.title: United Breweries rolls out Kingfisher Smooth in Karnataka, eyes growth in strong beer segment
articles.summary: United Breweries Limited launches Kingfisher Smooth in Karnataka, targeting younger consumers with a smoother strong beer. Kingfisher Smooth is priced from ₹100 to ₹200 across retail outlets.

articles.title: How Ajit Pawar shaped Maharashtra politics: Key milestones and roles
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister, died in a plane crash near Baramati, ending a decades-long career marked by political influence, finance expertise, and NCP leadership. Baramati was both the beginning and the end of his political journey.

articles.title: Remembering Ajit Pawar: Baramati strongman and architect of coalition power
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died at 66 in a plane crash at Baramati. His career spanned major political shifts, controversies, and a split from Sharad Pawar.

articles.title: TN polls: Only TVK has guts to take on 'evil force' DMK and 'corrupt' AIADMK, says Vijay
articles.summary: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam's Vijay positioned the Tamil Nadu Assembly elections 2026 as a democratic battle, unveiling the whistle symbol and challenging DMK, AIADMK, and BJP influence.

articles.title: Ram Mohan Naidu on Ajit Pawar air crash: Safety top priority, probe on
articles.summary: Ram Mohan Naidu visited Baramati after the plane crash that killed Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar. AAIB and DGCA are investigating the VT-SSK Learjet 45 accident.

articles.title: Watch | 30,000 tribal farmers’ long march from Nashik to Mumbai over land rights
articles.summary: The march, led by the CPI(M)-affiliated All India Kisan Sabha, began on Sunday after a protest at the Dindori tehsil office failed to get clear assurances from the administration.

articles.title: Eicher Pro X EV becomes first electric truck to finish Kashmir to Kanyakumari in 6-day run
articles.summary: Eicher Pro X EV completed the Kashmir to Kanyakumari route in a fully loaded condition, covering over 4,000 km in six days and setting four records recognised by the India Book of Records.

articles.title: Shambhavi Pathak, Sumit Kapoor and two others who died in plane crash along with Ajit Pawar
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar and four others died in a Learjet 45 crash at Baramati airport. Victims include Sumit Kapoor, Shambhavi Pathak, Pinki Mali, and Vidhit Jadhav.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar's death leaves Maharashtra politics without its key power broker — what next
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar died in a plane crash on January 28, raising pressing questions about the future of his party and the political landscape in Marathwada. With elections approaching, the party’s next moves and leadership plans remain unclear, leaving Maharashtra politics in a state of flux.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar's plane crashed after losing control, caught fire and exploded: Eyewitnesses
articles.summary: The illfated aircraft carrying Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar appeared "a bit unstable in the air" and exploded the moment it crashed on the ground near Baramati in Pune district on Wednesday morning, according to a woman eyewitness.

articles.title: Maharashtra Dy CM Ajit Pawar's plane crash captured in CCTV | Video
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar and four others died in a plane crash near Baramati, Pune. Chilling CCTV footage shows the deadly descent. Emergency teams and DGCA are investigating as family members arrive.

articles.title: Maharashtra's top post eluded Ajit Pawar after six stints as Deputy CM
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s deputy chief minister six times, died in a Baramati air crash, leaving his dream of becoming chief minister unfulfilled and NCP’s future uncertain.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: What we know about Learjet 45 aircraft and operator VSR Ventures
articles.summary: Five people, including Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, died when a VSR Ventures Bombardier Learjet 45 crashed during landing at Baramati on a Mumbai–Baramati flight, with AAIB leading the probe.

articles.title: Mira Bhayander's bizarre flyover: MMRDA's defence fails to reassure citizens
articles.summary: The Mira-Bhayander flyover starts as a four-lane road in Bhayandar East but suddenly reduces to two lanes after a sharp turn.

articles.title: Flight operations hit in Srinagar, Delhi due to bad weather; airlines issue advisories
articles.summary: A total of 58 flights were cancelled in Srinagar because of the snowfall. Leading carriers including IndiGo, Akasa Air and SpiceJet cautioned passengers about potential delays and disruptions.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar dies in plane crash in Maharashtra's Baramati
articles.summary: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's plane crashed In Maharashtra's Baramati. There were reportedly five people onboard Ajit Pawar's private plane, including a pilot and a crew, DGCA said.

articles.title: Avalanche hits Jammu and Kashmir’s Sonamarg; warnings issued for Uttarakhand too
articles.summary: Uttarkashi, Chamoli and Rudraprayag districts have been placed under ‘orange’ alert, indicating deep and unstable snow cover with a high probability of natural avalanches reaching valley floors.

articles.title: Delhi traffic advisory for Jan 28: Restrictions on these routes for Beating Retreat rehearsals
articles.summary: Delhi Traffic Police will impose restrictions near Vijay Chowk on January 28 from 4 pm to 6 pm for Beating Retreat rehearsals. Commuters should use alternate routes and follow advisories.

articles.title: Ayodhya GST officer resigns, escalating tensions between religious leader and UP government
articles.summary: He said he was deeply hurt by remarks made by Shankaracharya Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati, which he felt insulted the chief minister and prime minister - a step he said he could not tolerate as a public servant.

articles.title: From Amazon to The Washington Post, Bezos' cost-cutting playbook tightens
articles.summary: Fears of layoffs at Amazon have reached Jeff Bezos-owned newspaper The Washington Post where journalists fear that a similar drive to trim costs could hollow out one of the paper’s core strengths.

articles.title: Pinterest to lay off 15% of workforce in global restructuring push toward AI
articles.summary: The cuts are part of a broader transformation effort focused on reallocating resources toward AI-driven roles, prioritising AI-powered products and capabilities, and reshaping its go-to-market strategy.

articles.title: Amazon email slip reveals planned AWS layoffs
articles.summary: The content of the email reportedly also indicated that those that will be affected by layoffs were notified.

articles.title: Lawsuit alleges Meta can read WhatsApp chats; company calls it frivolous
articles.summary: According to Bloomberg, the lawsuit argues Meta’s privacy claims are false, alleging WhatsApp can “store, analyze, and access virtually all of WhatsApp users’ purportedly ‘private’ communications.”

articles.title: AI buildout to drive memory chip shortages through 2027: Synopsys CEO
articles.summary: Most memory chips available in the market today are directed towards building AI infrastructure, leaving other market segments such as consumer electronics, starved. Prices of smartphones and personal computers are expected to see sharp increase.

articles.title: Why China’s viral ‘Are You Dead Yet?’ app is striking a chord with Gen Z
articles.summary: China’s viral ‘Are You Dead Yet?’ app is gaining traction among Gen Z living alone. Here’s how it works and why young users relate to it.

articles.title: Sam Altman to visit India in mid-February as global AI heavyweights converge on New Delhi
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will visit India in mid-February during the India AI Impact Summit, holding closed-door meetings as global AI firms intensify focus on India.

articles.title: Tech wrap this week: Motorola Signature, Realme Neo 8, and Lava Blaze Duo 3
articles.summary: Motorola launched its Signature smartphone and Moto Watch in India on January 23, following its worldwide debut at the Consumer Electronics Show 2026 earlier this month.

articles.title: Davos 2026 | Semiconductors are no longer a luxury, they’re a necessity, says RRP Group’s Chodankar
articles.summary: RRP Group Chairman and CEO Rajendra Chodankar outlines the company’s semiconductor roadmap, highlighting government support, Sachin Tendulkar’s role as a strategic investor, and plans to invest ₹12,000 crore in a Maharashtra-based fab with a focus on thermal imaging applications.

articles.title: Amazon to lay off thousands in second wave of job cuts within three months
articles.summary: A Reddit group for Amazon employees say the layoffs could be announced on January 27 or 28. Discussion on January layoff at the company show two employees from Poland were already axed this week.

articles.title: Bank of America CEO says AI spending will drive returns in 2026, bullish on India growth
articles.summary: On India, the CEO said he expected 6.5% GDP growth in 2026, pointing to policies that have made the country increasingly business-friendly.

articles.title: Gold, silver prices in India hit all-time highs on strong global cues
articles.summary: Gold and silver prices in India hit all-time highs on MCX, driven by global gains, US policy uncertainty, a weaker dollar, and strong safe-haven and industrial demand, say analysts.

articles.title: Silver stays near all-time high level: Factors behind metal’s sharp surge
articles.summary: Silver jumped nearly 60% this year to a record $117.69 an ounce, driven by investor demand and the India-EU Free Trade Agreement, experts say.

articles.title: Gold, silver rates at all-time high in India: Key factors at play
articles.summary: Gold futures hit ₹1.59 lakh per 10 grams and silver ₹3.54 lakh per kg on MCX, driven by global rallies, rupee weakness, and geopolitical tensions.

articles.title: What’s driving silver’s sharp rally
articles.summary: Silver surged 6.4 percent to 110.60 dollars an ounce amid US tariff tensions and a weak dollar, outperforming gold and prompting volatility, says Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd.

articles.title: Why gold climbed to an all-time high today
articles.summary: Gold hit a record $5,042.98 per ounce as investors seek safety amid geopolitical tensions, a weaker US dollar, and strong central bank demand, with further gains possible, say analysts.

articles.title: Gold outperforms equities as Indian markets see narrow participation, says PL Asset Management
articles.summary: PL Asset Management reports Indian equities are consolidating with limited large-cap gains, while gold and silver outperform amid global uncertainty and cautious investor sentiment.

articles.summary: January optimism often fades in February. Here’s why motivation drops after New Year goals, and how to reset your mindset without guilt.

articles.summary: February is the perfect month for reflective reading. Discover how slow, thoughtful books can help you pause, reconnect, and reset emotionally.

articles.summary: YourStory presents the daily news roundup from the Indian startup ecosystem and beyond. Here’s the roundup for Wednesday, January 28, 2026.

articles.summary: Infrastructure readiness and deeper gas markets will determine consumption growth, says Akhil Mehrotra.

articles.summary: Apple has launched a new Black Unity Braided Solo Loop for Apple Watch, celebrating Black History Month and supporting creative programs worldwide.

articles.summary: IndiGo aims to carry 20 crore people on over 4,000 daily flights by 2030, CEO Pieter Elbers says in first media interaction since the flight crisis in December.

articles.summary: The Adani-Embraer tie-up isn't just about assembling a regional aircraft but also about progressive technology transfer to a robust supply chain.

US markets today: S&P 500 crosses 7,000 for first time; tech stocks, AI optimism keep Wall Street buoyant

Investors are betting on future monetary easing, with Nvidia leading the charge. Gold prices also hit new highs, while overseas markets showed mixed performance.

articles.title: Star Health net profit rises four-fold to Rs 449 crore in Q3FY26
Streamer Ray J hospitalized and warned about failing heart after years of drinking and partying
articles.summary: Rapper Ray J has revealed doctors warn his "time is limited" due to severe heart damage, functioning at only 25% capacity. He attributes this to years of heavy drinking and partying, leading to a recent hospitalization for pneumonia and heart pain. Despite travel warnings, he plans a trip to Haiti for treatment, hoping to survive.
